Reviews.Title: A camera that doesn't cause my wife to close her eyes!!
Reviews.Author: R. M. Roberts
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have tried various cameras, but nearly all of them result in photos where her eyes are closed. It became a bit of a family joke, but it's actually very frustrating. Several years ago her sister bought a Kodak camera and the photos were terrific, so we bought a Kodak V603 and loved it. No more closed eyes, wonderful colors, great Schneider lens, and it had a nifty little video camera included, was compact, etc. It just recently broke, so we were in the market for a new camera. Luckily, Kodak was just about to release this 580, also with a Schneider lens.The camera arrived today, is still compact (though a little bigger than our V603), has a much larger viewing screen, and easy to use buttons. The first few photos resulted in her eyes partially closed, but once I selected the "Red-Eye Preflash" option everything was great. Photo after photo and eyes were wide open and beautiful! We're very pleased.The video looks great and should be just as easy to pull off the camera as in earlier versions. We don't really need the 14 Megapixels (who really does?), but I guess one never knows when we might need to blow up a photo to billboard size. Also, the "blue" color is much cooler than expected -- it's really more like a steel blue. The strap took 10 seconds to put on and it took just a few minutes to navigate the directories, set the date & time, and to insert the battery and memory card (memory was purchased separately).I suggest watching the price, because it will undoubtedly drop. Also, each time I checked the listing over the first week of sale the seller changed between Amazon and independent retailers. Something to keep in mind as you calculate shipping and return policies.

Reviews.Title: Kodak releases a camera when smaller seems better.
Reviews.Author: Sean Clyne
Reviews.Content: I have been spending months looking for a camera with a quality lens that was still pocket size. Most of my prior cameras had Schneider lens and I have been a long time supporter of the Kodak company so the two cameras I finally had to decide between were the z950 and the M580.  I liked the large aperture of these cameras since most people take photos indoors and I couldn't believe you would get the same photo quality on a lens the size of an erasure head. The z950 has a slightly larger lens but it also has a large housing for the camera. it is .4 inches larger in each measurement. In reviews this was a deal-breaker for many other users. I liked the idea of a larger camera but ultimately chose M580.  The time between power up and first shot is quicker. And although I cannot give specifics the burst photography is much more reliable on the M580. The z950 is quicker between photo one and two, but I have found that when you are needing to take a series of photos quickly (i.e. kids are doing something quickly) the photo taken split seconds after the first one contain the same problems as the original picture. The processing screen still shows up after the second photo but it only is there for half of a second before you get the opportunity to click again. The z950 has a 3 second delay. In today's fast paced world that is an eternity.  The last reason I chose the M580 was the button layout. I prefer the zoom buttons on the back of the unit. The dial used in the z950 work better when you have your eye pressed against a view finder. The buttons are more distinct on top of the z950. That being said I have yet to press the wrong button by mistake on the m580.

Reviews.Title: This camera is amazing
Reviews.Author: dejenerate "pizza enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to buy this camera since there seemed to be very few reviews, and of those there were, half were great and the other half were terrible. Well, I am glad that I bought this camera. I am familiar with Kodak cameras, as my last camera was a Kodak Easyshare V1253. This camera is great! The flash is incredibly strong, and pictures taken come out brilliantly lit, and the colors are amazing. I took a simple picture of my kitchen, and I was amazed at how beautiful the picture looked! I didn't even realize my kitchen looked like that! Really though, I haven't found any problems with this camera yet. The video it takes is nice quality, but the camera's sound itself is quite quiet. That's to say that, when reviewing videos taken, it's hard to hear what I videotaped. BUT, I'm sure the sound will be fine once the video will be played on a computer or such. I don't have anything bad to say about this camera. I love the 8x zoom, the wide angle lens... everything. If you are not sure whether to buy this camera, I would say to definitely at least give it a try. I find going to Best Buy and playing with the cameras VERY helpful. You can hold the camera you might end up buying in your own hands, and play with the settings, and see how the general photo quality is. In conclusion, this camera is great!!

Reviews.Title: Camera Freezes and Pictures are Blurry
Reviews.Author: Jesaro "Jesaro"
Reviews.Content: I pre-ordered this camera and was excited when I received it a couple days after its release.  It was out of the box two hours before I started having problems.  When I would use the date stamp feature for my photos, the camera would freeze about every 5th picture and I would have to pull the battery as all the other buttons - including the on/off button - would no longer work.Hoping I could see past this I continued to use it. However, it would sometimes freeze after taking a picture and, like the problem with the date stamping, I would have to pull the battery.  This would also result in the loss of the picture I just took.What finally did it for me was that even with the image stabilization lens, the pictures came out terribly blurry.  This is my sixth Kodak camera and the pictures taken on my 3.1 MP Kodak from 2004 were far better.  I know how to work Kodak cameras and on every setting I tried, the pictures came out blurry.  The Smart Capture feature seems to make the pictures overexposed.  The same picture taken on Smart Capture on my Z950 came out considerably crisper with more true-to-life colors.Due to the freezing and the blurry images, this will be the second Kodak I've ever returned.  It's too bad.  I really wanted to like this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome, simple point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I got this camera and absolutely love it.  The M580 has the best picture quality I've ever had in a digital point and shoot.  This is due to the Schneider lens,  extremely high end lens in a sub-$200 camera, makes for great pics, and this holds through all 8 lenses.  Zoom is a bit extreme, you need to have a steady hand when you're out to 8X, but you get used to it - honestly, would be fine with just a 5X.The Share feature is great, love the expandable memory, and the camera has USB and HDMI built in, along with 720p High Definition Video capability.Expandable card slots are awesome, and the flash is pretty good for a small camera.Best feature to me is the wide angle 28mm lens - great for scenes or for making small stuff look large.  Excellent mode control and great features, very simple to use.I've had the freeze problem very rarely, but this usually comes when I'm slamming through too many commands at once. Easy reset to crack the battery partway out and push it back in.Great Camera!

Reviews.Title: Sept.2010 firmware update fixes freeze-ups
Reviews.Author: Stephen Fitzgerald
Reviews.Content: Kodak EasyShare M580 14MP Digital Camera with 8x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 3.0 Inch LCD (Purple)We purchased this camera from a nationally known mega store at a lower price than is now available anywhere. The thing that attracted us was the 8x optical zoom which is twice and then some that of any other camera in this price range $120-$160, which is great for taking Graduation pics.The pictures are clear and in focus and with the 14MP can be zoomed in on and cropped to the specific subject. There was a problem we had with it freezing up when changing modes (example:from pictures to video)when we 1st go it then I found that Kodak had a firmware update that fixed this problem (pay very close attention to the instructions)and since then no more freeze-ups. The video quality is good even in low light the only draw with video is that it is in .mov format and you'll need Apple Quicktime newest version to view then and some other app to convert them to make a DVD.  I do recommend this camera for its many features,ease of use,and affordability.

Reviews.Title: This camera is great for the price but...
Reviews.Author: Lisa Lukasik
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera FOR THE PRICE.  I purchased this camera thru a television shopping channel and after the rebate I paid eighty nine dollars, free shipping and four value pays for it.  Not bad!  However, you get what you pay for.  I was simply looking for a quick, cheap, easy, point and shoot with video capability to replace a 3 1/2 year old Sony that takes mostly blurry pictures, freezes on focusing and has a small viewing screen that I paid over two hundred dollars for.  I currently have a DSLR Canon Rebel 450D Xsi that I absolutely LOVE but it's a bit bulky for some occasions.After reading many reviews I have to agree with others, yes, this camera DOES freeze.  I think it mainly happens when I take a picture and my finger presses down on two buttons at the same time since all the buttons on top are right next to each other without any space between them.  When that happens I just open the bottom battery cover, let the battery pop out for a split second, push it back in and close the cover again.  Yes, that's a bit of a pain and I would hate to miss a shot cuz of that but I didn't buy this camera for anything important so it's not a big deal to me.  I just think of the price I paid for it.  And really it's not much different than my Sony freezing having focusing problems and I'm slamming my finger down on the button and the stupid thing won't shoot sometimes causing me to miss a shot anyway.  I'm probably going to buy another new point and shoot in another 2 years when technology advances, etc. anyway.The other thing true about this camera is that it can occasionally take blurry pictures but you know what?  That's with many digital cameras these days, even my DSLR Canon.  All you have to do is breathe while you snap and boom you get a blurry shot.  However, this camera can also take INCREDIBLE pics when the lighting is right, you hold your breath and you get the right angle.  I wouldn't say the pics are as nice as my DSLR but they are pretty nice for an eighty nine dollar camera.  Also, as for pics in the dark, I stood in a dark corner by my house, late at night, and took a picture of a bunch of leaves that I couldn't even tell what color they were in the dark and they came out incredible!!  Also took a picture of the full moon and well, it's not perfectly clear but cuz of the great zoom, it didnt come out half bad.  However if I tried to do that with my old Sony 3x or 4x zoom, the moon would look like a little white spec.The downloading of pics to a computer is a breeze.  I have a 5 year old computer with Windows XP and all I did was plug the camera in and it did its own thing after a click or two.  Then I had the pics in a folder on my computer in a matter of seconds.  I apologize but I have not used the video feature as of yet and was waiting until I recieved my memory card to try that out.Please be advised this camera does not come with a memory card and when you try to take pictures with it out of the box, you can only take up to 17 pics and then you have to download them or erase them to take more.  As for what the max capacity of a memory card you can use, after emailing tech support because I could not find it anywhere in the box, booklet, etc. I found out by the next day via email back that this camera can take up to 32GB SDHC memory card!!!!Many speak of the battery life for this camera or lack thereof.  I find it to use up a little bit more battery life than my DSLR Canon and my Sony.  Not a big deal.  I picked up an additional battery for twenty bucks which you should always do for every camera anyway.So, after reading this, you are thinking to yourself "should I bother with this camera?" Well, my answer is yes only for these reasons... 1)if you don't need this camera for anything important,2)you want a knock-around point and shoot, 3)if this is for a youngster (especially for the "easyshare" feature to facebook, youtube, etc. and 4)if it's about $100 or less.  Otherwise of course there are better camera's out there...

Reviews.Title: Broken out of box
Reviews.Author: Jerrod Prevost
Reviews.Content: I got this camera after having a Canon for a couple years.  The Canon was good but kept complaining that the batteries were dead even if brand new. I also wanted something with more MP and a faster.  Anyway, I charged up the Kodak and used it once.  The next time I tried it the lens would come out half way and it would tell me something like "Please remove the lens cap"!  Of course it has no lens cap which I thought was amusing if not annoying.  I let it sit for a day and then tried it again and it seemed fine.  Then it did the lens thing again and was stuck in the out position.  It also would not even power on anymore.  So, I returned it for a refund.  Very unimpressed.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: britt
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because my Kodak M1033 broke about a week before I was going on Vacation to the Grand Canyon and Las Vegas. I loved my old camera, so easy to use and took great pictures. They do not carry the other model anymore so I bought the M580.  I was NOT disappointed.  The camera is SO easy to use and the pictures it takes are awesome.  Also takes great panoramic photos.  I am no camera genius and the pictures I have are better than some of the photos taken by a friend on the trip who used a VERY expensive, very bulky camera.  I recommend this camera.  And buy from Amazon.  I tried about 5 different stores and even with the 2 day shipping the camera costs less than any store I tried.

Reviews.Title: Should have listened to prior feedback
Reviews.Author: 2cute
Reviews.Content: I used this camera, brand new, for two hours.It froze, requiring battery removal to reset.It has a failed pixel on the display, which shows in red.Kodak Tech Support told me that this camera had editing features so that video ends can be trimmed; it does.  They further told me that the video taken by this camera would play on my Kodak Easyshare M820 Picture frame.  It doesn't.  Not even before trimming.  Not even with the exact same memory card used in the camera without moving or copying the file.This was my first Kodak digital camera.  It will be my last.  Back to Sony. :)I figured that as long as this camera had been on the market, the kinks would be worked out, and I'd get a good one.  Not.

Reviews.Title: Decent features, but the common problem...
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: As many have said, the camera certainly takes decent pictures. There were a few things I liked about it:1. Records good video with sound during zoom. Many point-and-shoot cameras cut sound out during zoom or cannot zoom at all. You can change the quality from HD to standard, as well. A nice addition.2. Brilliant 14MP quality on subjects about 1-2 meters away.3. Panorama mode. While not a "sweep panorama", the 3 picture mode on this model is sufficient and easy to use.4. Can actually switch automatically between macro and auto-focus/infinity based on what you are pointing the camera at.5. Really liked the strong zoom capabilities. Although at full zoom pictures aren't amazing, no camera for less than a thousand bucks can offer that.There were also some things I didn't love:1. Macro mode, in one word or less - HORRIBLE. Taking pictures close-up (and no matter what setting - macro, text, Image Stabilizer, flash/no flash) looks a bit like what things may look like with a blood-alcohol content above .30. It is near impossible to get a solid picture at closer than 6 inches. Flash will "white-out" any object, and no flash will cause complete blurriness.2. Ease-of use. While some cameras have a dial to change settings, this one is a single button placed on top of the camera next to the flash. And it is flush with the camera, just like the flash and shutter buttons. For those of you who need something really easy, this isn't the one for you. Although I had no major problems finding anything, I was not impressed by the navigability. Not to mention, every time you turn the camera off and go to use it again, the setting goes back to the default. To get the one you wanted, you have to go through and find it again. And finding scene settings (night portrait, fireworks, snow, etc.) can take a little while.3. Editing ability/red-eye. There aren't any real editing features in-camera like I hoped for. I took several pictures of a friend (trying to dial in the settings) and found that the "red-eye removal" feature doesn't always do its job. You can set it to pre-flash or digital correction. While I had more luck with digital correction, red-eye was still sometimes a problem, and unlike my ancient Samsung SL310, you cannot enter the picture in the camera and remove it.The ugly:You've either read about it before or will read about it after this....FREEZE!Like the majority of other reviewers, I also was the victim of the camera's meaningless tendency to suddenly and inexplicably quit working. As I was thumbing through some pictures I had taken and decided that I was actually liking the camera, the screen went totally black. The camera stayed on, soI had to remove the battery and put it back in just to get the thing to turn off. It happened a second time shortly after the first. I had taken no more that 25 or 30 pictures in a two-hour period and already had a big issue. Others mention that the battery takes too long to charge, but since I returned the camera immediately after the second time it froze, I cannot comment on that. I did initially charge the battery after I checked the level, which was about half strength, and it seemed to charge at a normal pace. But a brand new camera should not have a problem like the one I (and many others) experienced. There is a reason that the word "freezing" is in the tags at the bottom of the review screen.I can't say I loved the camera but I also didn't hate it.  I have operated worse in the same price range, but also some that were/are far better. As far as a recommendation, all I can say is proceed with caution. Make sure you purchase it from a retailer that allows returns without a big fight (Amazon, Wal-Mart).

Reviews.Title: It was love at first sight
Reviews.Author: andy
Reviews.Content: I had a canon camera and well I loved but it got lost.  I decided to tell my mom to buy this camera for my birthday. It came in not so long ago and I tested it out by taking pictures of my mom, who by the way never can pose for a picture. I was able to catch natural pictures of her laughing and they looked professional even in her dim room.I can honestly say I like it more than my canon so far. I did read about the freezing but I also read that an update of the frimware needs to be done in the Kodak website. I guess on my birthday which is a month away I will test that out.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: R. Harbert "Bob"
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for a couple months and I'm looking to give it away to someone who needs a toy camera.  I couldn't be more disappointed in a camera than this one.If you are taking portrait pictures close up it's not bad but don't plan on taking scenery pictures or anything at a distance greater than 25 ft.  You loose all detail.  When I open this picture in Adobe Photoshop and look at the image in actual size it looks like a colored pencil sketch.  No detail.  Just a blur that looks like an impressionist painted it.Then there is the 8x optical zoom!  What a joke.  Don't even plan on using it.  I've seen digital zooms that do a better job than this one.  I can't say it enough!  This camera is just an absolute disappointment.Don't even plan on using the video camera.  I was out in the woods and a flock of turkeys went by me.  I was excited to have a video of it and when I got home and viewed it on the computer, I had brown blotches of blur that moved across the screen.  Absolute Junk!This camera has absolutely soured me on Kodak cameras.  I'm going to buy a Canon and hopefully I'll have better luck with them.

Reviews.Title: Kodak or Kodiak?
Reviews.Author: Tin Tan "TNT"
Reviews.Content: Kodak or Kodiak? That is, frozen, as in Kodiak, Alaska? I tested out the camera, learned its functions, and the very second I said to myself, This is a great camera--- it froze. No functions worked, including off, and I finally removed then put in the battery in order to get the camera running. Of course, the first thing I did was to go back to the Amazon reviews. Confirmed it's a common problem. Well, Merry Christmas to me. I will return it unless Kodak can explain how to fix it. Comment: I have problems with increasingly sophisticated electronics being unreliable, even from the most reliable brands- for example, my Panasonic DVR (even my Honda, but I won't go there). It too froze frequently. I think that 1) they are being rushed to market without proper testing; 2)these devices are like primitive computers that are being asked to perform complex functions; and 3)they are manufactured in or parts are sourced from a certain country with little regard for quality control- not their fault, but the corporate, bottom line mentality that sent our jobs elsewhere. We have it all, just don't expect it to work.

Reviews.Title: This camera is only OK.
Reviews.Author: katie "katie"
Reviews.Content: My husband bought this camera for me for Christmas this year. It would not have been the one I bought, as I don't care much about the "EasyShare" feature. I am perfectly capable of uploading any and all photos as I see fit, without a 'special little red button' that says 'share' on it.That (mostly useless feature) aside, the camera itself works well, for the most part.  I get great pictures, quickly processed, so that I can continue clicking away.  I would say this is NOT the camera for you if you aren't patient and willing to click a million times to get that one fabulous shot.I have 3 kids and I love taking pictures of them. I take 10 and keep 3.I too, have had an issue with the camera freezing up and having to turn it off manually by removing the battery. It happens when I've taken many in a row or if I'm trying to do many different things quickly.Also, we only paid $70 for this camera. I would wait for a sale. :)

Reviews.Title: Kodak Does It Again!
Reviews.Author: Jarrod
Reviews.Content: Update 1/18/10: My Kodak M580 recently started to get weird colored spots all over the LCD screen when I made an HD or SD video. At first I thought it was something smudged onto the screen, but it was also in the video once I uploaded it to my computer. One of my friends recently had the same issue too with the same exact camera. I went in exchanged my M580 for another one before my 30 days ended. I got another one and it has the same exact thing...... except worse now! Good bye Kodak. I had success with you in the past, but not anymore. This camera takes great pictures, but these spots appearing in the videos is a no no. I guess you call these dead pixels or hot pixels. I have no idea, but there is no way to get rid of them. I have tons on the screen. Apparently Kodak's new stuff isn't built as good as theie old models.I didn't even own this camera a month. I am very disappointed in Kodak & their customer support is god awful. Will not be doing business with them again. Sony Cybershot here I come! :)The below review was posted before I had all the spot issues.I've had great success with Kodak Easyshare in the past. I own an older Easyshare CX7530 and it stills works perfect. It was time for an upgrade though, so I picked out the Kodak Easyshare M580. The Kodak M580 is a top notch digital camera. It takes absolutely stunning photos and you can even crop and edit your pictures right off your camera! It also shoots in crystal clear 720P HD and it looks and sounds fantastic! You can even zoom in and out while your filming. It's very easy to use and so simple. The M580 uses it's own battery and charges in about an hour or two for me. The LCD screen is very bright and can be turned down to save battery life if you want. It's such a great camera to own and will for sure bring you lots of joy. I've only had it a few weeks and have had a blast using it. The Kodak software is pretty easy to use as well. You don't even need a cd, you just plug it into your computer with the usb cable. It's a great camera to own for those that like to take pictures on the go, or make videos clips. The Kodak Easyshare M580 is easy, affordable, and absolutely awesome camera! Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Best Camera for Real Estate
Reviews.Author: TN REALTOR
Reviews.Content: This camera has made my job a lot easier! I can take wide angle pictures and close up pictures. The camera makes it easy to walk through and do a video that I can post to youtube or my website. Great deal and I would suggest this camera to everyone. Very easy to download and organize pictures.

Reviews.Title: I think I like it
Reviews.Author: Katielee "Katielee"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this in an after Christmas Sale, something like 60% off.I have an older Kodak 6440 that I love (see an earlier review). I took many pics out hiking with it last summer and got many, many compliments on the quality.But it is only 4 mp, so I've been wanting to upgrade. And I wanted another Kodak.(My kids have had other brands including 2 Sony's that gave out after a year). I knew from my 6440, the lens really does make a difference, and it has the Schneider Kreuznach Veriagon lens. The M580 has the Schneider Kreuznach lens, and combined with the sale price decided to go for it, despite mixed reviews. Over all I like it. I can't seem to get the brackets to center on faces as it should, but that doesn't seem to make any difference in picture quality. My pics are sharp and clear. So far most my pics are my dog, and a couple shots out walking along the Rims this spring, but they all have a very nice quality. I'm looking forward to taking it hiking with me and see how it does. Although I might get the Z981 or Max for that.I did have the freeze problem once, and like other's had to take the battery out. I haven't had it since.I would recommend this camera for someone who cares about picture quality, and easy use. I haven't been disappointed by Kodak yet.***Update***I had some frustrations with this as I used it with the settings, and picture crispness---and purchased a Nikon L120 for hiking and vacations. I did play with a couple things, the ISO, reset it to infinity etc, and am much happier with it---although it seems to reset somethings as soon as it's turned off. In spite of my frustration (I'm so not techy to begin with) with the settings & menu, I really would still recommend this camera & I still think it deserves a 4, not a 5 because the menu is a bit of a challenge. I think I'll like it quite a bit for less formal pics, and all around picture taking.***UPdate*** Overall I'm satisfied with this camera, and use it quite a bit for casual pictures. I used it a lot on my grandkids. It does take very clear and bright casual pics. And action shots are pretty impressive just on auto, catching water drops splashing as the girls were swimming & the video is surprisingly good. More than satisfactory for snapshots, and compact so it's easy to haul around.  I would still recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera but Kodak Ads are Not Truthful
Reviews.Author: lw
Reviews.Content: This camera takes beautiful 14MP pictures and the HD videos are as good as they get with a digital camera of this type. The sound is very sensitive and picks up all the action. And you can't really appreciate the quality of the pictures until you connect your camera to a big screen HD TV. The quality is stunning. And another great feature is the battery charging system. It charges from a USB port on your laptop or through an electrical outlet. And if you're near an electrical outlet when you're shooting video, you can just plug it in and not even use the batteries. The few draw backs I've experienced are the buttons are too small for my big fingers and I'm not a big fan of the video "mov" format. Several of the better movie processing software programs will not recognize and you must convert to another format.Now then, to the Kodak misrepresentation in their ads. Even though the Kodak ad says it does...even though the Kodak online manual shows you how to cut it on and off...this camera does NOT have the "Image Stabilization" that is advertised. One Kodak agent told me when you depress the shutter button 1/2 way that activates the "Image Stabilization." I said great, now what about shooting videos? I talked to several tech support agents concerning this and they all tried to take me to the place on the camera to set "Image Stabilization." It is NOT there. I might also mention that to deal with Kodak tech support...you will need to be multilingual and don't waste your time asking for the location or phone number of their main American headquarters, because that must be a well guarded company secret they're not allowed to share.In my search for the ever elusive "Image Stabilization" features on my camera, "Polly R." of Kodak tech support was kind enough to inform me by email:"Thank you for contacting Kodak Technical Support.We understand that you would like to know how to set the Image Stabilization feature of your Kodak EasyShare M580 digital camera.We appreciate the chance to be of assistance.Upon checking the setting of the M580, the setting is not available on the camera. The feature can be automatically activated when you press the shutter button halfway to focus and set exposure. You will see green framing mark when the picture is stabilized.We would like to thank you for bringing this to our attention, rest assured this will be forwarded to proper department."Would I buy the Kodak M580 camera again? By all means. It is one of the finest cameras for under a hundred dollars with many great features and the pictures and videos are so incredible...you don't even miss the lack of image stabilization! However, my longtime trust in Kodak ads may be fractured forever.

Reviews.Title: unhappy with purchase
Reviews.Author: Deanna
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a Christmas gift for my parents as an upgrade to their older version of the Easy Share. I had read some mixed reviews on the camera but purchased it anyway thinking I'd take a chance and I really wish I didn't. My parents have had problems with this camera from early on, almost right out of the box....sometimes it works and sometimes it doesnt. There are problems with it turning on as well as with the lense opening and closing (getting stuck when it's out, etc). When it does work, the pictures are not even clear and often come out blurry. I would not suggest buying this camera at all. Additionally, I purchased this from Portable Guy, a third party vendor with Amazon.com. I will never do that again. Amazon honors partial refunds after the inital 30 day full refund period has passed. When I reached out to Portable Guy, he was unable to do any sort of refund for me and did not seem to care that I was having issues with the camera. In the future, I will be sure to purchase items that are only through amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but the second defective Kodak in a year
Reviews.Author: S. Cameron
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera all around. It's the second Kodak in a row we've bought that has the same exact issue. It shuts down unexpectedly - just shuts down with the lens open and no power. It does this within a short time after having been charged and sometimes a long time after. Now I can't figure out where or how to return it for replacement. This is really, really annoying!

Reviews.Title: Great pics, great HD video, mediocre features
Reviews.Author: D. Scherpelz
Reviews.Content: Pics and video are spectacular. Took some HD video over the weekend and the resulting files are awesome. Pics are great quality, too. Menu navigation to enable some advanced features is a little cumbersome - you have to use a combination of buttons from the top and back of the camera to change modes. I'd rather have more controls on the back of the camera; but that might sacrifice the screen size which is very large. Terrific point and shoot camera. Highly recommend for basic pics & video.

Reviews.Title: Kodak East Share: Another Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Roxanne Bush
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kodak Easy Share camera and I will not purchase one again.  The Panarama is very difficult to use as you have to take 3 different shots, these are stiched together and the results are not so good.  Also, you need to load the Kodak software on each computer/laptop so you can share pics..not always convenient.  Also the camera randomly shuts down.  It is a very user friendly camera however and I liked the larger screen but it was difficult to see in sunny weather.  Overall, very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare
Reviews.Author: John 28
Reviews.Content: I like the zoom, timer and able to use different scene options. I was disappointed that the date is not automatically put on each picture but can be put on manually. Wish the battery charger was external. Have not used it enough to know about the battery life. It is small enough to put in your pocket and carry along.

Reviews.Title: So You Need Something Simple
Reviews.Author: Dustbunny
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera bug for over forty years. Have owned hundreds of cameras. Photo and video is easy to use and big playback screen is a plus. Lightweight. The lens doesn't focus quickly - sometimes not at all. Zoom is slow to pull in but nice to have when it works. Buttons are tiny and not the easiest to locate. Have to keep it plugged into the recharger almost constantly. No low charge warning. Just cuts off. All in all I preferred my old Canon Sureshot AA eater. ( my tip: if you love photos...do yourself a favor and order a card reader to download your photos to your computer in the wink of an eye)

Reviews.Title: Easy to Understand and high Megapixel
Reviews.Author: Steve T. Ludington "baby giraffe"
Reviews.Content: Compared to the Kodak V1003, these cameras have gone a long way! this one is still just as easy to use except its lighter, more ergonomic, higher mega pixel, amazing zoom, and a really good size screen. If you want a camera for under $150, this is the best one you'll find. But make sure you buy a memory card! the high quality means the pictures take a good amount of space

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Stacij
Reviews.Content: I love my camera so far!  I need to play around with it a little more to learn all of the features but so far I'm loving it!!

Reviews.Title: Average Camera
Reviews.Author: James Cook
Reviews.Content: This is an average camera - the only thing I really can say is outstanding is the optical zoom.  The rest of the features and functionality are pretty standard.  That's what you get at this pricepoint.  Overall I wouldn't recommend for or against this product, it is overwhelmingly average.  The good thing is that I never had an issue with it.

Reviews.Title: Freezes and Malfunctions
Reviews.Author: Burger Brain
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera back in December 2010 thinking I was getting a great deal for the megapixels and optical zoom, plus the reviews were good at the time. Since September 2011 it has been acting up. It will freeze for no reason and I'll have to take the battery out to make it work again. In the last 3 months just about every time I take a picture and go to review it it won't be there unless I fidget with the menu and view it according to date. Pictures from months ago will show up as the last picture taken even though I just took a picture. It's getting really annoying and I wish I wouldn't have bought it. Also when viewing my pictures, the camera will act up and start going super fast at reviewing them even though I'm not pressing any buttons. I also hate the fact that your scene settings reset every time you turn on the camera. My old Kodak z730 never did that. The buttons on top are too close together also. I would not recommend buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever!
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: I puchased this camera about half a year ago, and it's just amazing. It takes great quality pictures and video, has good optical zoom, and the price is a steal! I highly recommend this product!(P.S. some of the camera's from this model (including mine) had a software issue that causes the camera to freeze sometimes. however, kodak has an update for the software on their website, and after downloading it my camera has worked fine)

Reviews.Title: Review Kodak M-580
Reviews.Author: Michael T. Santarsiero
Reviews.Content: Over all this is a great camera, the pictures have a great quality and it really make colors bright! However I have had it freeze a couple of times because I pushed buttons too quickly for it.  The video quality could be better but the frame by frame is a great feature.  Sound on the video is great and the fact that you can take a frame from a video and make a picture of it is amazing.  Zoom is more than I expected it to be and the self timer blinking light and second counting beeping is great so your face isn't pasted with a smile.  The multiple scene settings that it has really makes it easy to capture great shots.  Facial recognition is amazing, it hasn't failed me.  The smart capture is great because you don't have to chose your scene setting, it knows, well most of the time.  It gets self portrait every time.  Great for a beginner photographer, even my friend who has a super expensive camera was impressed with it and was considering getting it as her "carry-around" camera. I would recomend this to all my friends and family looking for an easy to use camera.

Reviews.Title: "Kodak easyshare software has stopped working"
Reviews.Author: Dallas Guy
Reviews.Content: I was getting the message "Kodak easyshare software has stopped working" and couldn't find any forum with an answer. I called customer support and they were able to help me. I was running Vista 64 bit. And apparently the default installation installs in under the "c:\Program Files (x86)\" folder instead of the "c:\Program Files\" folder. They had me uninstall the software then create the folder "Kodak" under "c:\Program Files\". They also had me delete the "Kodak" folder under "c:\Program Files (x86)\" which I had trouble doing. I ended up having to go down in that directory and delete some of the files individually. In the end they said it was okay to leave a few files there. I then reinstalled the software - using custom settings and selected the "c:\Program Files\Kodak\" folder to install. After restarting it worked. This is a pretty simply error in the software that the programmers should have fixed. Fortunately the help people were helpful!

Reviews.Title: Caution
Reviews.Author: KenDay
Reviews.Content: Be careful.  Seems to be a great little camera at a great value.  But mine is freezing up, forcing me to remove the battery.  Did a chat with Kodak, did some diagnostics, and they concluded the camera was fine.  It isn't.  It freezes.  Some people don't seem to have this problem, and I can't get it to do it on demand.  Maybe I got a lemon.  Mine will go back and I may try another M580.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Shots
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed having this camera when I went on my trip to Israel. It took beautiful shots of everything. The shutter lag time was very quick for a point and shoot. I was able to get some amazing pictures from the bus window with it. It was great in sunlight and captured the colors beautifully. I used it in addition to my Nikon SLR.The video it shot was beautiful. I will definitely be able to use the footage for making some videos.I loved the panoramic feature as well. It was great for shots of Jerusalem and the country side of Galilee.Over all I was quite pleased with my purchase and the price. It is an amazing point and shoot.Update Sept 30While this camera takes beautiful pictures it is NOT a rugged camera. If dropped the lens will break. I had this happen on two separate occasions. The first time I was still within the return policy so I returned it and bough a new one. The second one I sent the camera to the repair place Kodak recommended and had it fixed. It is not as good as new now but it still takes decent pictures and serves the purpose I bought it for.Its still a great point and shoot for its price range but it cannot take a beating.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Terri
Reviews.Content: I wanted a cemera for family pictures and trips. The camera is good size for putting in your pocket. Easy to use just turn it on and it finds the the best options.I like the Share for facebook it makes it easy to put the pictures on the website. I really like this camera.

Reviews.Title: I like it!
Reviews.Author: D. Limke
Reviews.Content: I'm not a techie kind of guy, so that's why I keep buying Kodaks. They are easy to use (dummy proof) and I've never taken a picture I didn't like. The picture quality is always great.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good camera
Reviews.Author: Dawn Carella
Reviews.Content: Camera ok.  Took pictures and/or video and would freeze so I would have to take battery out and put right back in.  That would fix problem and it would be ok. Picture quality is ok too.

Reviews.Title: By far the worst camera I have ever purchased
Reviews.Author: CHARLES BAKER
Reviews.Content: This Camera is the only camera I have owned that freezes ( Literally will not turn off move or anything) you have to take the battey out and put it back in to turn it off. Horrible focus on the camera would not recommend to anyone. Some cool in theory features but if the camera freezes and cant focus whats the point? Pass on this one ladies and gents.

Reviews.Title: KODAK CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Joan
Reviews.Content: ONE OF THE BEST LITTLE CAMERAS ON THE MARKET.  I HAVE TAKEN IT EVERY WHERE.  TO PARTIES - TO MANY EVENTS.  ON TRIPS. ON CRUISES, CHURCH EVENT.JUST LOVE IT!.

Reviews.Title: To Good To Be True
Reviews.Author: Sandra Seppanen
Reviews.Content: I got this for my Christmas present a few years back. I really wanted a camera and this was the best one at the time for a low price. 14MP 8x Optical zoom to good to be true!Pros- Easy to use- Great Mp and Zoom- Great priceCons- Freezes up sometimes ( Have to take out battery and put it back in)- LOUD whirring noise- Not as good of picture quality as I expectedOverall you might want to give the M583 a try. This camera is OK but not great.

Reviews.Title: camera disappoints
Reviews.Author: Wired on all
Reviews.Content: This camera [ASIN:B0031RGGC0 Kodak Easyshare M580 14 MP Digital Camera with 8x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Blue)]]came from Amazon within a week and was fairly easy to learn to use; however, there were two apparent problems from the start.  One was that the Kodak software that was to be loaded to my computer from the camera caused my computer to lock up whenever I tried to download pictures to my computer.  The other problem was that the camera would periodically lock up and I would have to remove and re-insert the battery to get anything to work!  After spending several hours on internet chat with Kodak, they had me mail the camera in for repair (under warranty).  I'm still waiting for it to come back.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this camera, money wasting
Reviews.Author: Turker Girgin
Reviews.Content: This is (was) my third Kodak and will be the last one!! I will never buy Kodak any more.My last 2 cameras does not work for the same reason!!Battery problem!! I have bought M580 August 2010 and last week it was shot down and never came back.I tried all method that I found on internet and discover that most people has the same problem.Kodak is guilty to launch to the market such a bad quality camera, not good for the reputation.However I got my lesson and now I am looking for new digital camera by reading customer reviews !!If you would like to waste your money buy a Kodak M580 and start to fix your battery problem eventrying to put the battery in the freezer to fix battery charging problem like me :) , desperately..

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare M580 is OK...
Reviews.Author: Cindi P "cindipierce"
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd Kodak EasyShare camera I've owned - I keep upgrading because I liked them so well, but wanted even better quality photos.  However, this 1 is a bit disappointing for @ least 2 reasons:  1) there is no way to turn on the date feature that will automatically put the date on each picture like previous cameras did - you have to date each photo!; & 2)  I, too, have the problem that the camera just freezes up after putting the date on about 10 photos - it will not do anything @ all, & you literally have to take the batter out to reset it!?

Reviews.Title: a finicky camera that can amaze you
Reviews.Author: Cedar
Reviews.Content: I'll preface this review by saying that I am picky when it comes to photographs. I am not, however, one to buy expensive cameras. I don't like the attention they bring, don't like their weight, and don't like worrying about dropping them or losing them. I like inexpensive cameras that perform.I have found the M580 to be a difficult camera to operate. It takes too long to start up, too long to take a photo, and too long to change settings. Sometimes when I am navigating through the menu, the camera takes control away from me and starts scrolling through all the options endlessly. Talk about a ghost in the machine. Most of the photos (about 90%) I am not happy with. They are either blurry or not exposed properly. But 10% of the photos I get are close to flawless--gorgeous colors and razor sharp focus. I am a Dad, so I mostly photograph my young children. I have taken several iconic photos with this camera--that is, photos that I intend to have and cherish for the rest of my life. Because of that, I cannot say I regret buying this camera. I will probably continue to use it on occasion and will hope for the best, but it is not the first camera I grab when we head off to the pool or the park.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy this camera
Reviews.Author: Coco
Reviews.Content: I CANNOT recommend this camera for anyone.  What a disappointment.  The battery life has been a problem from the beginning.  Within a couple hours of using it, you can tell the battery is getting low.  The zoom is another problem.  MOST pictures blur if you try to use the slightest amount of zoom.  I read the reviews on this camera before I purchased it.  Most of them were not good.  I should have listened to them.

Reviews.Title: very disatisfied customer
Reviews.Author: tommusicman
Reviews.Content: this unit has been nothing but trouble ever since we started using it. it froze up many times, we now have had to replace the battery for a cost of 42.00 at best buy. this was a brand new unit and battery that came with the camera. kodak needs to go back make something good again. i think i will buy any more of there products.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Abdg
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before buying this camera, it had great reviews at the time I purchased it, I see now they've gone down. But at the time, I thought I was getting a great camera, for a great price, and for the first 3 months I loved it. It took great pictures and the clarity and ease of use was pretty good as well. BUT- after only 3 months, it got bumped (not dropped, or anything minutely major) and it was done from then on. Wouldn't ever focus again. My warranty was void after 90 days which it was just a few days beyond that. So I pitched it, and I'll be going back to Canon. At least my old Canon camera survived the first 5 years of new babies, and still works and admittedly has been abused and is still going. This kodak camera I guarded with my life, wanted to take super good care of it and did, still died. So disappointed in the cheap quality.

Reviews.Title: megazoom junk
Reviews.Author: Konstantin "Konstantin"
Reviews.Content: I bought this based on good technical specs, it seems to be the best value for money. It is not. Yes, zoom is really good, but it can not focus at room light, display shows colors strongly yellow-green biased, buttons are small and hard to use. Very bad nosy pictures. My recently lost 5 year old Canon ixus50 was much better by all parameters, except for less powerful zoom.Do not make a mistake, buy something else.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera...
Reviews.Author: BrandyShew
Reviews.Content: Great little camera. Easy to use, great pictures, lots of options. Still learning about all of them! Like it so much, bought another one for a friend for Christmas. He likes it, too.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: David McDevitt
Reviews.Content: Completely broke after I dropped it once. Now I know that dropping a piece of electronics is not recommended, but most of them can take a little bit of abuse. This camera can't.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Ditigal Pictures at a reasonable cost
Reviews.Author: Glen Yeate
Reviews.Content: I have several Kodak cameras and this is my favorite.  It takes great pictures that out shine the more expensive SLR.  The German lense is what makes this an outstanding camera and great value.  Kodak has been a favorite of mine for a long time.  My brother has an expensive Nikon and we took group family pictures with our camera's side by side and Kodak won in clairity by far.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: It Ain't Me "It Ain't Me"
Reviews.Content: Kodak invented digital photography and it shows with this camera.  The easiest point and shoot camera I have ever used!

Reviews.Title: good pocket sized camera
Reviews.Author: DCDeals
Reviews.Content: it does a real good job , its as good as any Ive had in the price range, maybe better

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Meg
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a gift for my great niece and she loves it.  She had no problems learning to use it and it seems to be a very good camera. I have an earlier model Easyshare and have had no problems with it.

Reviews.Title: Versatile point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Saunders
Reviews.Content: This is an easy to use point and shoot which is very versatile with great zoom capability and picture resolution.

Reviews.Title: Kodak M580 14 MP Digital Camera with 8x Wide Angle Optical Zoom - Excellent camera for kids at camp
Reviews.Author: RatherLiveInKeyWest
Reviews.Content: Purchased this Kodak M580 a couple years before Kodak filed bankruptcy in 2012, and got it specifically for our son & daughter to take to camp. Wanted a small camera for them to easily carry around in their pocket that would take high-rez pictures, that had an optical zoom (digital zooms can be frustrating), that would be easy for them to use and share pics, and would not break my bank. This camera met those needs perfectly.The 8X zoom is really great - a real optical zoom that, unlike digital zooms I have used, you don't have to fight with software to get it to work properly. Real optics -- yeah! In addition, the LCD screen is well lit and large enough to use and review pics, and the image it produces is bright and clear.Have never cared for third-party image software -- we just upload the pics and use our own software to crop, resize and retouch -- and this camera's interface with our laptops and cloud is seamless via USB.The only reason for a four star rating is that, like others, we have experienced the occasional total freeze requiring us to take the battery out in order to get it to restart. Have never lost pictures due to this, and it has only happened a handful of times, but it is an inconvenience that we wish did not occur. A handful of times in 3 years... given the price, the quality pics, and the perfect size for our need, I would purchase it again.

Reviews.Title: Superb!
Reviews.Author: Monarch
Reviews.Content: Wow what a great purchase ! Excellent camera and fast delivery Too bad Kodak tanked This is my fourth camera I recommend putting a strap on it

Reviews.Title: Kodak easyshare,is easy
Reviews.Author: amma2evan
Reviews.Content: Great camera, easy to use and upload. I like that you can send pics to email only or upload to computor only or both, Note: Kodak gallery is no longer available.Camera is a nice size.I would recomend 100%

Reviews.Title: its okay
Reviews.Author: Jo
Reviews.Content: not as easy to use as my former Kodak Easyshare nor are the pictures as good of quality that I had with other camera

Reviews.Title: lloydgbe
Reviews.Author: LLOYDk
Reviews.Content: I would have given this item a five star if it had not been for the thing frezzing up on me once, the shutter would not work on two occasions. price is good and pictures are great, seems lately it take a lot longer to load on computer than at first

Reviews.Title: I Love This Amazing Camera!
Reviews.Author: Tara
Reviews.Content: Even though Kodak is out of business we still replaced our old Kodak M580 with an exact replacement.  Can't find a camera for this price that I like that is better.  Especially one that has the stabilizing image option.  I can shake the camera like crazy while taking a picture and the result is a nice, clear image!  Amazing!

Reviews.Title: Always Blurry
Reviews.Author: S. Thompson
Reviews.Content: We bought this hoping it would be an improvement on our previous Kodak Easyshare 12MP camera, but we were wrong. The photos are almost always blurry, regardless of the setting we use. Fortunately with the recent focus on improving smartphone cameras we don't even need a point-and-shoot camera anymore. Tough luck Kodak, our next dedicated camera will be a DSLR

Reviews.Title: Really like this camera!!
Reviews.Author: TVR
Reviews.Content: I've had this Kodak M580 for a couple of years now. I wanted something that took quality pictures, had a good amount of optical zoom, and had a decent amount of features, but not some $500+ camera with a bunch of features that I would never use. This camera fits the bill perfectly.The 8X zoom Schneider lens is really great. It lets you get in nice and close and the auto focus does a really good job when zooming in. You can also change the setting to macro, which will let you take close up pictures of really small things like flowers or other small objects and still pick up the fine details. The LCD screen is big enough to see well, and give a nice clear image when viewing the photos you've taken.I also use this camera to take product photos for my business. The macro feature combined with the the adjustable exposure compensation makes it really easy to take nice and bright, vibrant, close up photos of our products. I barely have to edit the images at all before uploading them to the web. If you sell products on ebay or your own website, this camera works perfect for taking excellent product photos.I didn't bother with the Kodak software that came with it, I just plug it in to my PC and retrieve the pictures just like I would off of a flash drive. I would definitely buy this camera again if the one I have ever lets me down, but so far I've had zero problems and only good things to say. This was a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera - easy to use
Reviews.Author: Lance Hokanson
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 4 months now.  It's very easy to use, small enough to carry in a pocket, but large enough to make it easy to hold.  Pictures turn out just fine - and I don't have real steady hands.  The 8X zoom at this price is a nice feature.  The only down sides are: 1) The power button is super small.  You almost need to get the edge of your fingernail in there to turn it on or off.  2) It sometimes freezes.  You can download and install the firmware upgrade, but it will still freeze sometimes.  When it does you just need to take out the battery and memory card.  Put the battery back in.  Turn it on.  Turn it off.  Then put the memory card back in.  It's a bit of a pain, but it's only happened a couple of times.  For someone like me that wants to just turn a camera on and take a decent picture this was a great camera.

Reviews.Title: After just over a year, this camera broke
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Murray
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I had a previous camera with the same type of lens.  I have owned Kodak cameras for years, but this one broke after just over a year.  The back panel just popped off.  I also had to be more careful with keeping my hand steady, as my photos would blur.  The auto setting was also not the best choice, so I have had to play around with different settings to get good pictures.  I am now looking for a non-Kodak camera.

Reviews.Title: great deal
Reviews.Author: cheap buyer
Reviews.Content: so i bought this in office depot for $110, which kind of makes me mad b/c it's on here for 80, but it's a great deal for either price. it does great panoramas and the optical zoom is good. mine's even survived a second or 2 under 6 inches of water. i did have a slight glitch with it at one point where it wasn't loading the pics, and now i just have to use the sd to transport them. the video recording is pretty good, and i love how it brings out the colors in everything; grass looks a lot greener but still totally natural and flowers look much brighter than they really do but again, with a  natural look. the audio isn't bad. speaker is  quiet. battery is the one complaint. i can get like 500 pics at most on one battery, which is like barely a full day of pictures for me; i would order a second battery.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera for the Price.
Reviews.Author: Storm30062
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived on time.  It is just a great point-and-shoot camera!  This is the second M580 I bought from Amazon (the first was stolen  [:-((].  I have had no problems at all with either one.  I think that the problem one owner reported about the difficulty of displaying the date on the picture is because he did not download/read the owners manual, which states that the date the picture was taken in embedded in the properties of the picture (right click it).  It is easy enough to date stamp the picture, if you want is shown.  However, for me, it is more important to easily access the date than to have it displayed on the picture.  There have been several reports of the camera locking-up.  I have not had this happen and believe that it is due to pushing two buttons simultaneously and confusing the firmware.  I understand that Kodak has a firmware update though, I have had no problems and have not researched/downloaded it.  The buttons are rather close to each other and I would have designed them differently.  After I took a few pictures, I was used to it.  I very carefully shopped this camera before I purchased it and could not find anything else that came close to 14 MP with such a high quality lens and great zoom.  This is just a great camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: camera freeze fix
Reviews.Author: deb
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for the price due to it having a HDMI outlet.  To prevent the freezing problem, you can go to the KODAK site and download a program to the camera which does prevent the freezing, just google m580 freezing firmware update and you can get the firmware update.  I know it sounds crazy to buy something that you have to fix immediately after you take it out of the box, but I did buy it a year ago, knowing it would freeze and I would have to fix it when it came...I bought it because like I said I wanted the HDMI feature and the price was right and the free downloaded firmware did fix the freezing.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare M580
Reviews.Author: Hoppinbev
Reviews.Content: This Kodak Easyshare M580 camera is just right for me.  Easy to use, small to fit in purse, takes good pictures, easy to transfer pictures and also to charge battery.  It is a great camera for that price, and I love it.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Camera
Reviews.Author: ng
Reviews.Content: I like my camera, have only taken about 100 pictures so far.  Very good zoom lens.  Happy to have purchased this one while there were still some available.  Sad to see Kodak go after all these years with great products.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera...Kodak's last horrah.
Reviews.Author: Ray
Reviews.Content: Bought this for just $69.99, Ive had many more expensive bulkier cameras since they're inception and i have to say this is a great little camera. Color rendition is exceptional for this price range and intel focus is fast.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare M580
Reviews.Author: Paul Says...
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Easyshare M580 has many "pluses" that make this a great camera for point & shoot purposes.PROS:  Easy MENU to follow, excellent quality pictures, self-contained rechargeable Ion batteryCONS:  The shutter button is fairly "non-descript" and when asking someone else to take your picture they have a hard time finding the button and determining if they pushed it down far enough.Overall a good camera for the person with the experience of using it but difficult for a person unfamiliar to get used to the shutter button.

Reviews.Title: Kodak m580 digital camera
Reviews.Author: mamatlee
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a week and so far love it! It has great zoom and is compact.For $79.00 well worth it!!

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare M580
Reviews.Author: Pamela M Rose
Reviews.Content: Ordered this for a gift....decided to make sure it was charged, in working order etc. And to my surprise, the camera was not Blue but Grey. Camera appears to be of good quality. It arrived with no damage and included everything the description said it would.

Reviews.Title: kodak M580 Camera
Reviews.Author: barb
Reviews.Content: I think this camera is good for someone like me, an amatuer camera user. Very easy to use, self explanitory instructioons on the viewing window and easy to revue pictures on the computer. The 8X zoom is great and the pics come out good.

Reviews.Title: NICE camera
Reviews.Author: Ronald
Reviews.Content: I finally got this after reviewing several sites and stores its easy to use, compact has very shap pictures, it cam in the mail in only two days, and i give the company a very high rating

Reviews.Title: Easyshare M580
Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: Kodak Easyshare M580 14 MP Digital Camera with 8x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Blue) I've never taken really good pictures and don't understand the new digital technology.  This M580 was a breeze, its so easy to work with, picture taken was a snap, then with the "share" feature, it was easy to download the pictures onto my hard drive.  I'm very happy I purchased this model.

Reviews.Title: Caution..
Reviews.Author: a grateful Convert "St. Bartholomew"
Reviews.Content: Slightly difficult to get used to the small buttons on top.  Used for a few days on a trip to the florida Keys.  Picture quality was very good and overall decided to keep the camera....until it wouldn't download the pictures.  My computer  said my USB port had been locked as this port had exceed safe limits. Then camera would turn on or off.  DId onlin chat and sent to authorized repair with was over $10.00 shipping with insurance.  Two weeks later repaired camera arrived. Upon arriveal seems the battery won't charge now. Another online chat and again they want me to send to authorized repair center.  After only owning for 60 days I am returning to retailer hoping for a credit.  Pretty sure I don't want another Kodak camera. Kodak EasyShare M580 14MP Digital Camera with 8x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 3.0 Inch LCD (Blue)

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for!
Reviews.Author: Kandy
Reviews.Content: I am just getting accustomed to using it, but so far I love the camera and the accompanying software. I love that it is red. I am forever putting my camera down and forgetting where I left it. Now it jumps out at me! The camera is very user-friendly, and puts a lot of features at my fingertips.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Wes Thayer
Reviews.Content: Great little camera.  Takes excellant pictures night or day, bright or cloudy, close or far.  I really like it.  I carry it on my belt everyday.  Never know when I'll be taking a picture."smile you're on candid camera"

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: badkat83
Reviews.Content: I love all Kodak cameras but this one is terrible.  I thought it would be a good one!  Good zoom and good features.  BUT it is always blurry when you take a picture.  I am very disappointed in this camera and should have returned it!

Reviews.Title: Dead Junk
Reviews.Author: hotgrandma
Reviews.Content: Takes an o.k picture and video but when you don,t use it for three days the battery is dead. Called kodak and they said remove battery when not using. Shouldn,t have to do that. Dont waste any money on this one. Instead of buying a cheap camera and not being satisfied, then buying another better one, just buy a good 500-600 dollar camera right away, you are going to spend it anyway on cameras that won,t work for you.

Reviews.Title: Kodak M580
Reviews.Author: GPG
Reviews.Content: All the functions needed and expected, but without the complications.  Easy to use , great pics and uploads are a breeze.

Reviews.Title: great camera!!
Reviews.Author: B. Culbertson
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera! It was shipped quickly from the seller.  After arriving it took about 10 seconds to start taking exceptional pictures.  I would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: "Lens Obstruction"
Reviews.Author: Carrie McCrosky
Reviews.Content: I got this camera in March , this was my third  Kodak digital camera, I was really liking it until I turned it on one day and the lens comes out only partially and immediately goes back in with  the message " Lens Obstruction". I have not been rough with this camera, it has never been dropped, occasionally it will work  say 1 out of 20 times being turned on. It is fully charged, appears to be completely undamaged, have tried compressed air. Has anyone else had this problem? I see most everyone who has a negative review too purchased about the same time I did, perhaps a faulty batch of cameras? Basically was great until it  mysteriously stopped working .October 2,2011 Edit, My camera jsut completely stopped working, no turning on, nothing, completely unresponsive.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Gift
Reviews.Author: Helice E. Jones
Reviews.Content: This camera was given as a gift.  The person who received the camera really likes it and can't wait to fully utilize it.  It very compact and easy to use from what I see and would be a great gift to anyone who likes to take pictures.

Reviews.Title: Buttons too small.  Good features, but returned.
Reviews.Author: joyceomaha
Reviews.Content: Purchased from [...] but later returned the camera.  Too compact for me.  Buttons on top difficult to use.  Later purchased the Kodak Z950 (from Amazon.com,) which I had been considering for nearly a year, but when the M580 came out, I decided to try it.  Should have purchased the Z950 a long time ago.  Only thing I don't like about the Z950, is the low volume for video playback and no adjustment for it.

Reviews.Title: Everyone say "Freeze"!!
Reviews.Author: Jenny "Healthy Girl"
Reviews.Content: I only owned this camera for two days when it froze up on me TWICE!  When it freezes up you can't turn it off or anything, you have to take the battery out to get it working again. Also the Easyshare feature is lame as you still have to hook the camera up to a computer for your picture to be loaded, so what's the point?!?!Also purchased a NEW Kodak SD card,(the same one pictured on the box!), that wouldn't work with the camera!?!? It kept giving me an error message say it was incompatible, did I mention that it was the same exact one that was on the cover of the box?  Anyway, I got frustrated and put the card in my mother's camera to see if it would work in her camera and I got this nice little message that said:  "Card needs formatting", I clicked "ok", then her camera formatted the SD card!! When I transferred the card into this camera it now worked, so why the hell didn't it just format the f$*ing card instead of telling me it was incompatible!?!? Piece of crap, you're going back!!

Reviews.Title: Avoid purchasing this camera
Reviews.Author: C. J. Casper "batjed"
Reviews.Content: My Father in law purchased this camera for my birthday because my wife didn't have enough time to research buying one herself. The camera he ordered didn't arrive on time so he went to the store to buy one.  Unfortunately, he bought this one.  The reviews for this camera are bad and the actual product is representative of them.  The first problem we noticed is the buttons on the top are all clumped together and easy to fat finger (or if you have gloves on or something) then you can't take a picture easily or you turn the flash off instead of taking a picture (and turning the camera on quickly to catch that magic moment is problematic).  That alone was really annoying.  But it gets worse, most of the pictures are blurry.  Prompting me to say to my wife we should throw this thing away.  It was a half joke because it costs too much money to just throw away.  But then, after about a month of mild and occasional use, the lens stopped retracting.  It tries to retract but doesn't.  I was glad.  It made me feel a lot better about throwing it away for real.  I didn't even bother with the warranty.  I don't want this thing fixed or replaced.  I want a camera that works and that has better reviews. Don't risk buying this camera. It's junk.

Reviews.Title: eh - nothing standout here.
Reviews.Author: J. Houser
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera hoping that EasyShare meant that I could upload photos directly from the camera to the internet via wi-fi. I should have read closer. You can't. I am disappointed that you can't find a camera out there that does this. Seems like every other device in my cachet has wi-fi. As far as a camera goes, it's nothing amazing for the price. If you're brand loyal, this might be nice for you. If not, get a Canon.

Reviews.Title: this camera is JUNK!!
Reviews.Author: jodie benson
Reviews.Content: I have a Kodak Easyshare camera that is about 8 years old that I just love so when it started getting slow I shopped around and finally ordered this one expecting the same great camera. I got it in January and it is absolute JUNK! Almost every picture I have taken turns out blurry no matter what setting it is on and even when the camera is sitting on a tripod. While on vacation I was trying to delete a bad picture and when it asked if I wanted to delete all I pushed no and it deleted the whole card. Luckily it was on my first day and luckily i had brought my old camera with. This one went in the bag and didn't come out again. Now today I was reviewing pictures on a card and it stopped working completely. Froze up, couldn't turn it off, couldn't get the battery out. I say this is absolute junk and I am quite po'd that I wasted my money on it. IF you want a decent reliable camera DO NOT BUY THIS ONE! I will say it does take nice videos, but really, who wants a camera that can only do 1 thing?

Reviews.Title: Who thought this was a good idea?
Reviews.Author: gr8 reviewer
Reviews.Content: All I wanted was a camera that could "burn" the date into the picture, like all the ones I've had for the past 10 years.  I take a lot of rapid-fire pictures.  Some genius at Kodak decided the decision should only be made on a picture-by-picture basis, and to keep the feature on is not a good idea.  Hence, it got returned.

Reviews.Title: SMH.......
Reviews.Author: Mr Young
Reviews.Content: I've had my eye on the Kodak 580 for a while now checking out diff sites reading all the reviews sum great sum bad being my ole cam was a Kodak EASYSHARE Z760 6.1 Megapixel I fig I would gone head get it plus the price was right Ive had my new 580 all of 1 full day now and im bout ready to find me a brand to use. Just as sum of the reviews I've read the pics are just not up to par and it clams to hav "HD" video yeah if HD stands for highly dissappointed. My ole EASYSHARE Z760 6.1 Megapixel took wwwwwwwaaaayyy better pics and video then this 580. I'm VERY dissappointed in this 580!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: No Viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: There is no viewfinder so you must use the display on the back. This slows shooting down and makes the camera harder to use.I am disappointed in the lack of viewfinder and do not recommend this camera.The buttons are recessed and hard to find. This problem makes it easy to miss the photo. The aiming is difficult. The Zoom is hard to control thru the video display.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed.
Reviews.Author: C. Caballero "Gadget girl"
Reviews.Content: Only shares with Facebook, YouTube, etc. when plugged into your computer, not through bluetooth or wifi. Does not have the technology. If I have to plug the camera into my computer to share then I can just do it myself. So stupid.
